questions.question: I like to hang ……………………… with my friends in the evening.
questions.description: To hang out is to spend time relaxing and enjoying yourself.

questions.question: Before I could say anything she hung …………………….
questions.description: To hang up is to end a telephone conversation by cutting the connection.

questions.question: Hang ………………………. ! I am coming.
questions.description: To hang on is to wait for a short time.

questions.question: He is a cut ……………………….. the rest.
questions.description: When you are a cut above the rest, you are better than others.

questions.question: She is cut ……………………….. for the show business.
questions.description: If you are cut out for something, you have the right qualities for it.

questions.question: We will reach faster if we cut ……………………….. the meadow.
questions.description: To cut across something is to go through it.

questions.question: You always cut ……………………… when we are discussing something serious.
questions.description: To cut in is to interrupt someone.

questions.question: She looked cut ……………………. so I asked what the matter was.
I don’t like it when you run me ……………………… in front of my colleagues.
questions.description: To run somebody down is to criticize them.

questions.question: Let me run ………………………… the details of the program again.
questions.description: To run through is to go over as a quick rehearsal.

questions.question: Many top level athletes have pulled ………………………… of the event.
questions.description: To pull out is to withdraw.

questions.question: She can pull ……………………… any outfit.
questions.description: To pull off is to succeed in doing something difficult.
